text: The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, roasted coffee beans, lactose and malts. The color is pitch black and there is a small mocha colored head. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, roasted coffee beans, lactose, roasted malts and caramel. A really nice and silky smooth beer!
Tiefschwarz, angenehm Kaffee und Schokolade in der Nase, super cremig, angenehm Kaffee Schokolade
Espresso, feinst zerkleinert, bestäubt die Nüstern ✨ . Eine Rauchschwade, ein Rotfruchthopfen Sidekick, fertig ist der Cleary ☕ . Cool Stuff from the DANISH US ;).... MIKKELLER & FRIENDS. Tap.

330ml bottle, black color, with a frothy bubbly dark tan color head, with a sweet earthy molasses, lactose sugar , earthy greeny roasted coffee bean nose with some black, roasted, oat, wheat malty, subtle chocolate chip cookie dough accents, and a earthy minty chocolate bar, burnt toast, burnt wooden barrel note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth fluffy sweet fruity earthy roasted, black, chocolate, wheat, oat, toasted malty, burnt molasses character with some fruity burnt brownie, bitter sweet chocolate baking bar, burnt fruitcake, coffeeish, sweet lactose sugar, burnt chocolate cake flavours, leading towards a sweet burnt fruitcake, molases, lactose yeast sweetness, coffeeish, lingering fruity roasted, oat, wheat, chocolate malt bitterness finish.
Tap (Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen). Black with light brown head, good lacing. Coffee with milk in aroma. Sweet in taste like coffee with milk. Really drinkable, fully, very nice.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Faktycznie kawa z mlekiem :) Genialna pijalność!
Very nice. The typical very roasty flavors from Mikkeller are balanced with lactose. It works pretty well. Coffee adds additional mitigated roast.
Draft at Uiltje bar. Aroma of creamy coffee, chocolate and roasted malt. Flavor of soft roasted coffee, roasted malt, milk chocolate and cream. Solid stout, good example of the style.

Keg @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 18-12-2016.
As "Mikkeller San Diego Beer Geek Flat White".
In short: sweet harsh stout.
Pours hazy dark copper with nice tan head. Moderate head retention, little lacing. Roasty, nuts, malty, little smoky nose. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is harsh, roasty, some chocolate. Quite sweet finish.

From tap at Uiltje Bar, Haarlem, during Mikkeller tap takeover. Aroma is sweet dark malt, roast, creamy coffee, lactose, some fruity hoppy notes, chocolate, with a touch of liquorice. Flavour is pleasantly sweet with some bitterness in the finish. Body is medium to full. Not as smashing as some of the other Beer Geek brews (Brunch Weasel in particular), but a very fine rounded Sweet Stout.

On tap at Uiltje Bar, Haarlem during Mikkeller tap takeover. 
Nose is roasted peanuts, coffee. 
Body is black, head is medium, beige, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. 
Aroma is roasted peanuts, chocolate, roasted malt. 
Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. 
Finish is medium to long lasting roasty medium to heavy bitter. 
Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. 
Quite easy, strong flavor, simple but very tasty, great one.
12 oz bottle pours black with a tan head. Aroma of biscuits, coffee and vanilla. Taste is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, and caramel.

Bottle. Pitch black with little to no head. Aroma is of chocolate, dark fruits, caramel, biscuit, treacle, vanilla. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, lactose, vanilla, dark fruits, caramel. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Bottle. Black with one finger head. Coffee and lactose. Moderate roast. Light dark fruitiness, slightly acidic. Good, but not with the price.

On tap @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 16/12/2016 Tomada como San Diego flat White
Color negro, espuma beige, sabor dulce, cafe, rica, cuerpo denso.
Black body with brown head. Aroma has coffee, nuts, and vanilla. Taste is medium-heavy sweet and medium bitter. Medium to full body with creamy texture. Flat carbonation with light and bitter finish.
backlog. draft. Dark brown with a very firm beige head. Low on carbonation, a bit high on lactose. Medium bodied, very oily texture. Meeeh
UPDATED: NOV 14, 2016 Black with a tan head. Aroma of oatmeal coffee, and undertone of lactose. Taste is coffee and lactose.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller Beer Geek Flat White ].Clear medium to dark black brown color with a small to average, open and fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, chocolate, oat, dusty, milk chocolate. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long duration, lacto, milk chocolate, dusty, coffee - chocolate, dark malt, sweet malt, sugary. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161026]

Sort skum brun 
Mælk sukker malt brændt vaijle 
Bitter modrat sød meget 
Vandede blød 
@f1

Bottle 0,33l from Saveur web shop. Dark brown color, minimal head. Smell of coffee, dark chocolate, roast, a hint of acid, vanilla. Medium body, light carbonation. Taste of coffee, cocoa, roasted malt. Kick of bitterness in finish. Pleasant average sweetness. Long finish.

Black color, thin brownish head. Aroma of cocoa, coffee, milk chocolate, caramel. Taste of coffee, cocoa, roasted malt, nice fruity touch, caramel. Long cocoa, coffee sweetish finish. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Pretty awesome milk stout.
Bottle. Very dark oily pour with a quickly dissipating dark brown head. Coffee and lactose. Medium slick palate. Quite good.
On tap at Mikkeller Århus. Black with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of licorice and coffee. Sweet roasted flavour with licorice and coffee. Too sweet.

Bottle. Moderate to heavy toasted, dark chocolate and cereal for the malt, moderate resin for the hops, light to moderate earth for the yeast, with cardboard and scotch in the background. Head is small, frothy, light brown with some slippery and is fully diminishing. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, slick with a soft carbonation and a tart finish. Not a bad Imperial Stout, but maybe not so true to style.

Black color, tiny brown head. Coffee nose, roasted, dried fruit, licorice, dark chocolate, vanilla, hint of mustard. Sweet taste, roasted malt, coffee, licorice, milk chocolate. Full body, soft to flat carbonation, oily texture.

Black colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, toffee and some slight nutty and oatmeal notes. Flavour is rather similar, but also has some lactic and berryish notes. Nice coffee aftertaste in it.
Dark brown, almost black. Medium light brown creamy head. Slightly sour aroma with roasted notes. Strong bitterness and quite strong sourness, roasted and coffee notes. Sour aftertaste.

Very solid body for sweet stout, really nicely excels coffee like qualities, smooth vanilla, lovely not too pushy deep roast level and one of the best "milky" character implementations in beer. Moderate to light sweetness with light bitterness
enjoyable brew
Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Rich coffee with cream and sugar, chocolate candy, relatively mild roast, and moderate sweetness throughout. Pretty damn delicious.
Pours black with thin brown head. Medium body. Really lactose and vanilla forward. Not as good as the regular beer geek.

Perfect pour at Mikkeller Bar. Pours a dark brown black with a light brown head. Aromas of big chocolate fudge and big cold brew coffee. Taste is soft and fudgy with a coffee finish. One of the best Mikkeller beers I have had. Maybe the first in tap?

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a glass. Black with small beige head. Aroma is Katies with a little coffee, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is roasted malt, lactose, and some coffee.  Nice richness.

Draught at Mikkeller SF. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, milk, nuts, chocolate, vanilla and dark fruits. Bitter finish with roasted malts, milk,vanilla, hops, chocolate, coffee and dark fruits. Excellent stout.
How : bottle Appearance : almost black, no head. Aroma : strong coffee scent, dark syrup, ripe fruit, vanilla, some light spice notes. Palate : medium body, average to low carbonation.

Draught at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey. Opaque black beer with a rich lasting beige/brownish head. Roasted milk chocolate aroma, ice coffee, licorice, some dark fruits. Chocolate flavor, licorice, ice coffee, raisins and figs, some vanilla. Well hidden alcohol.
747414

Bottle. Poured dark brown with little life. The aroma is burnt malts, grainy, light coffee, dark chocolate. The flavor is light sweet with a rich smooth mellow sweet lactose, chocolate palate. Medium to full bodied with flat carbonation.
On tap at Bottle Shop London. Black beer lasting tan head. Intense dark malts aroma. Some tar. Its quite a big beer. Some intense coffee and oatmeal. Decent enough without exciting me.
Keg at the Bottle Shop Bermondsey; dark brown pour with a massive creamy tan head, aroma has strong espresso coffee, taste has creamy chocolate, some dark fruits, strong coffee.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 On tap. Sehr dunkel orange braunes Bier mit mittelgroßen schönen stabilen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, schokoladig, erdig, Kaffee. Geschmack süß schokoladig, Vanille, lecker.

Chocolate, intense, sweet coffee, dark, sweet, toasted malts. Black, small, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. More chocolate, black coffee, dark, toasted malts, light milk coffee, very lively carbonation. Nice Sweet Stout, not overly complex yet very decent. Keg at Bottle Shop, Bermondsey.
Aroma is dark/roasted malts, coffee and very slightly funky. The flavor is coffee, dark/roasted malts, chocolate, fruit and a mildly funky/earthy finish.

On tap @ Mikkeller San Francisco. Black in color with a thin tan head. Much more coffee on the nose than I expected...I guess I anticipated that this would just be a glass of sugar and vanilla. Its certainly on the sweet side, but theres a lot of dark chocolate, coffee, and some roasted malt. Nice full bodied beer with low to medium carbonation (works for the style). Its not my favorite, but its pretty decent for this kind of beer.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pitch black. "No" head, just a tan ring around the glass. Coffee and dark malt nose. Smells kind of dry. Dark chocolate, coffee, malt, caramel and chocolate milk flavour. Thick, very sticky body. Soft to flat carbonation. Sweet. Some bitterness in the ending. Good!
Svart med fingerhøyt beige skum som forsvinner fort. Lukter kakaopulver og kaffe. Middels fylde. Kaffe, mørk sjokolade og noe salt lakris. Noe søtlighet kommer utover.
Svart farge med lys brunt skum. Kaffe preger lukten. Men også kakao og vanilje. Fyldig, lite kullsyre. Kaffe og vanilje også i smak. Kort søt,salt avslutning.

Tasted from draft at Mikkeller beer bar. Pours Blake with thick tan head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is chocolate and coffee. Incredible creamy and chewy mouthfeel. Flavors of chocolate and vanilla. Think chocolate milkshake. A little coffee notes. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lukt: Kaffe, bek, krydder, mørk sjokolade.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Kaffe, kirsebær, frukter, sjokolade, vanilje.

33cl bottle from Uba & Humal, Tallinn. Rounded smooth malty nose. Really well balanced palate with delicious flavors from start to lenghty finish.
Tap. Black, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, & long finish.

7.5%ABV. Stout

Tapped out black.

Nose has smoke and roasty aromas. The smell of breakfast.

Mouthfeel is watery. Palate has liniment and herbal medicine, dark Chinese herbal tea comes to mind right away. There are light fruity flavors of dates, prunes, but so much that youd characterize this as having a fruity palate. There might even be some very brief fishy, amine-like flavors, very very very brief. Grain palate is roasted malt, raw wheat flour, raw oatmeal with the slightly powdery texture and mouthfeel.

Finish is clean. Overall al very pleasing stout experience. Solid, tasty and with a gracious clean finish.

Goes on Favorites List !
Fat @Mikkeller & Freinds. Svart öl med ett ljusbrunt skum. I doften finns malt, lätt rostat kaffe och inslag av choklad. I smaken tillkommer inslag av mjölk.

Bottle at Hopyard, november 13th 2015. Yet a fresh take on the beer geek. Black body, big beige head. Aroma of espresso, lactose, toffee and chocolate. Taste is actually quite resembling a flat white, also with a nut presence and earthy hops. Robust bitterness in finish, with a pleasant smooth coffee and milk aftertaste.

Draught at Mikkeller Pop Up (RIP). Rich dark roasted coffee flavor with notes of cream and vanilla, round mouthfeel, gentle sweet finish. Not a big fan of the style but this is pretty well balanced and enjoyable.
[5/14/16] Draught at Taphouse in Copenhagen. Black. Aroma of coffee, roast. Bittersweet flavor, roasty, with coffee, some milk.

Bottle. Dark brown colour. No head. Only very thin line of froth around the glass. Sour coffee beans and hints of berries in the aroma. Quite sour beginning. Lots of coffee. Coffee beans. Cocoa. Coffee in the end. Nicely chocolaty. Coffee also in the aftertaste. Good balance. Even refreshing like a morning coffee. Rather medium bodied, low carbonated, very enjoyable beer. Surprisingly good. Lactic character is really nicely kept on a leash.

Bottle. Poured clear dark brown color with medium tan frothy head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Medium to heavy roasted coffee, chocolate malt and lactic aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted sweet flavor with a medium to heavy dark sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met with a very good sweet stout.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours black with a creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, licorice, cocoa, dark chocolate, vanilla, little fruit. Flavor is ligght sweet, rich malty, cocoa, vanilla, chocolate, light smoke, coffee. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, light sweet finish with light warming alcohol. 150516
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Pitch black with a tan head. Notes of milky chocolate, light roast, coffee, cocoa powder and light vanilla.

Black pour with a thin tan to orange head and light lacing .... Aroma of lactose, sweet chocolate, cocoa powder, roasted malts, coffee and very light smoke .... Taste is of sweet lactose, cocoa, roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and very light hints of smoke and dark fruity yeast ..... Had a bitter, dry roasted finish with lingering sweet lactose .... Has a slick and oily mouthfeel .... Body is full .... Good stuff

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet and has loads of lactose. Also some vanilla, dark cocoa like malts, coffee and roasted malts. The taste is sweet and crew,y with notes of sweet lactose, coffee, cocoa beans and roasted malts. Pretty nice sweet stout.
Draught. Frothy white good mostly deminishing head. Black colour- Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. More coffee than lactose. Average heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.
48 tap at tap house.. Dark black... Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet chocolate roast. Dark malts. Dark roast.. Big chocolate roast.. Heavy roast... Dark chocolate.. Mellow chocolate roast
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Small head with short duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, caramel, nuts, vanilla and hops. Nice smooth and oily palate.
Tap at Mikkeller Pop UP. Initial huge coffee grounds aroma and taste, but little rich and sweet too, brown sugar. Little cola. Finishes pretty creamy and milky. Nice variation.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Black with a small light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and lactose. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and roasted moderate bitter finish. 090516

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus, 7,5%. Almost black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and lactose. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, lactose, hops, little espresso, medium sweet and a little bitter.

Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Lacto-forward nose with roasted malt, sorghum and some coffee notes. Roasted cacao nib and dark fruit on the palate with more of the lacto coming out. Creamy on the palate. Nice, slightly roasty finish. Enjoyable.
Pitch black color. Almost no head. Big bad black strap molasses, lactos, coffee, and dark fruit. Medium body with lots of cold coffee notes. Fairly smooth. Decent lingering finish.

Good rich deep beer, serious coffee and cream. Delicious. 

Good rich deep beer, serious coffee and cream. Delicious. 

Good rich deep beer, serious coffee and cream. Delicious.
Really dark, sweet caramel, chocolate, coffee, balanced taste overally, nice sweet aftertaste, light head with no much foam. Good anytime

Bottle; Aroma is very roasty, chillies, dark chocolate, cacao beans, milk sugar, dark coffee. Nearly black color, brown head. Flavor is full bodied, milk chocolate, hints of chillies, sweet malts, coffee, dark fruits, cacao. Very nice one.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours black with little brown head. Aroma with roasted malt, coffee, lactose and a little chocolate vanilla. Taste is sweet, with roasted malt, coffee, lactose and a dry, roasted slightly bitter finish. High drinkability.

Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, bread, and a bit of lactose. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and a bit of lactose, leading to a dry finish.
From tap at Taphouse. Black with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, caramel, lactose and bitterness.

Bottle shared by deyholla. Thanks D$. Pours dark with a ring of brown head. Aroma is sweet, slight coffee aroma. Tastes is sweet, chocolate my, dry. Not much coffee up front, some as it warms but not enough

Bottle. Pours black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has bitter chocolate and dark grains with a decent amount of roasted malts. Flavor has bitter coffee and roasted malts with some sweet dark grains backing.
(En fût à Bottlecraft Little Italy): Crémage à gateau limite acceptable niveau sucres. Hyper vanillé et lacté avec une touche noisettes et coco.
Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, cocoa, vanilla. Thick mouth, chewy, roast, vanilla, cocoa, bitter finish, very good.

Bottle @ Benzai, medium sample. Dark color, short frothy head. Aroma has lots of coffee, some roast, hint of lactose. Roasty bitterness in taste, quite dry, slight lactose sweetness, quite some coffee. Fairly dry for a sweet stout, because of the big amounts of coffee and roast. Nice one.
Tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weeken 2016, Tallinn. Colour is almost black with small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Dark chocolate, harshness, some lactoce and roasted malts.

Bottle @ home shared with Caesar. Opaque black color, virtually no head. Aroma is malts, coffee and rosted malts. Taste malts, roasted malts, coffee, nice malt bitter, some roast bitter as well. Dont get the typical sweet stout flavors and lactose, also dont get that but perhaps thats just me. Quite a lot of roast that lingers in the aftertaste. Medium to full body, decent carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Black color, murky. Small 1-finger diminishing, brown, frothy head. No lacing. Roasted malt aroma, a lot of coffee. Some caramel and nuts. Well balanced taste. Medium body. Smooth palate. Oily. Flat carbonation. Finish was dry, accented sour, burnt. Good stout, but I was expecting it will be more sweet

Tap at TCBW2016. Opaque color, small brownish head. Coconut, cocoa and toasted malts in the nose. Medium-bodied. Sweetish chocolate, cocoa, toasted malts. Lingering sweetish cocoa and toasted maltyness. Nice package.

On tap at TCBW 2016. Pitch black color, some offwhite foam. Medium / high aroma intensity ; licorice, milk, coffee, leather and vanilla. Full body & high complexity. Good bitterness and balance. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black. Dark roasty, coffee beany, some wood, dry chocolate. Full bodied, well bittered. Roasty, malty. Pretty good. Feels surprisingly easy. Basically a run of the mill mikkeller slight spiced imperial stout. Everyone will have had a dozens of these.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
33cl bottle. Dark color. Thin brown head. Medium bitterness, low to medium sweetness. Aroma is nutty, chocolate, roasted. Tasty.
Bottle. Pours oil black with low head. Aroma is oat, malts, coffee, hay. Taste is coffee, leather, malts, hops, maltose. Good palate.

Another Mikkeller stout, this time a hybrid between milk stout and oatmeal stout. Thin but lacing, pale greyish beige, stable head over a blackish beer with mahogany edges. Lovely stout aroma of cappuccino, wet leather, strong bayleaf, coffee cream, dried chili peppers though these have not been applied here, fondant chocolate, salmiak, beef broth, candied fig, teriyaki, cigar ashes, soggy brown bread, dried banana, toffee, vanilla, mocha ice cream, dried tree leaves, earthy turnip. Restrained but effective candied sweetness in the onset, dry figs, some subdued banana and dried berries paired with underlying blackberry sourish and beefy umami accents, soft carbo perfectly fit for the style, very creamy mouthfeel (oats!) achieved by sweet caramelly and nutty malts turning very gently toasted bitter, mouth-filling, a little bit soapy, very smooth and oily; chocolatey malt factor comes in with a coffeeish bitterness to it, but neither of them is exaggerated and they both remain friendly in relation to the milky creaminess. Finish is a continuation of this layered, pleasantly thick maltiness, bittersweet, whilst adding a dash of deeply peppery, leafy hop bitterness further balancing out the chocolate and caramel sweetness; roasted, deeply black coffee-like bitterness lingers for a long time after that. Alcohol goes by unnoticed apart from a faint glow in the back. Well crafted, not overly complex but balanced oatmeal stout with undeniable milk stout features; I cannot help but wonder what this adds to Mikkellers already vast range of beers, but I certainly enjoyed it. The flavor in its purest sense is mostly bittersweet plus umami, so you know what to expect...
Bottle from Binnys. Poured black with no head. Aroma dark roasty malt bitter coffee. Light carb med thick bod. Taste pretty bitter coffee bean.

Bottle pour opaque black with thin tan head. Nose roasted malt, lactose, coffee, initially some anise, but thankfully that clears. Taste bitter roasted chocolate, coffee, and some anise. Thick mouth feel. Bitter roasted finish.
On tap at Mikkeller SF. Black with a small head. Sweetish with coffee and roasted malt. The mouthfeel was medium.
@ Mikkeller SF: Tydlig söt av kaffe och socker. Eftersmaken ganska tydlig lakrits. Kanske något tunn

sample, deep murky black colour with a tanned head. nose of milk chocolate, oats, sweet bakers chocolate, milk lactose, roasted ground coffee, creamy mouthfeel. leading to a dry aftertaste. nice. enjoyable version

Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured dark brown with little life. The aroma is burnt malts, grainy, light coffee, dark chocolate. The flavour is light sweet with a rich smooth mellow sweet lactose, chocolate palate.
Medium to full bodied with flat carbonation.

Botella 33 cl de cervezalandia. Tomada en el momento en Oviedo 20..02..2016. (r75). En chapa: kl 13:07:57 bf: 04..09..20. Color negro intenso con poca espuma beige. Perfecta combinación de maltas tostadas, cacaos, vainilla, y sobretodo café y torrefacos con un gran toque de lactosas que lo suavizad todo. Amargo ligero y suave final. Cuerpo medio ligeramente pastoso y con algo de espuma con 7.5 vol perfectos. Gran combinación suave de sabores. Imprescindible. Para repetir sin duda.
Bottle purchased at Savor Growl. Black pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of coffee, cream and chocolate. Malty flavor with creamy lactose before a bitter coffee finish.

330ml bottle from Gallaghers Beer World/El Irlandés. Pours impenetrable dark brown, almost black, color with a small light brown head that disappears quickly and leaves no lacing. Aroma is strong on roasted malts. Notes of roasted coffee beans, burnt caramel, almond liquor, sherry, licorice and lactose. Some dark green herbs give this one an almost Jägermeister quality. Strange. Not bad. Taste is mellow, mildly sweet with lactose very present in the beginning. Soft coffee-ish flavors come through in the middle with some almond, liquor and green herbs shining towards the end. A roasted note is left behind as aftertaste. Smooth, velvety body. Very soft carbonation, almost not there. Alcohol has a pleasant warming effect. Overall this is an interesting and different Sweet Stout that reminded me a lot of Jägermeister+coffee.
12 ounce bottle. Pours dark. Tan head fades. Lactose coffee nose. But a smoke taste that no many others are getting. Not sure if its just this bottle.

WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, niska. dosyć trwała.
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Dobrej jakości świeżo palona z niewielkim dodatkiem śmietanki (laktoza). W tle zboża, popiół, kakao.
SMAK: Wytrawne. Analogicznie do zapachu. Gładka, oleista konsystencja. Długi kawowy posmak przełamana słodyczą laktozy
OGÓLNIE: Zdecydowanie jest to przedstawiciel tych bardziej wytrawnych (jeżeli można tak powiedzieć) milk stout-ów. Nie mniej bardzo , bardzo smaczne!
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are coffee, milky sweetness, and roasted malts.
Bottiglia da 33 cl comprata a lo sfuso a torino. Colore nero impenetrabile. Poca schiuma scura. Sentori di vaniglia. Finale erudito.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 an enjoyable coffee stout, though not quite a favorite. Average body for a stronger stout, though smooth with a light lactic quality and plenty of roasted malt and coffee. Slightly bitter. 
Bottle tried too...slightly off...still mid 3 but not a 4 like on tap.

330ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Very dark brown, almost black color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Chilly, peppery, roasted malts, vanilla, beans in aroma. Rosemary, sage, thyme, fuckin mix of herbs, some roasted malts and lots of sugar in taste. Rosemary, some chilly and sugar in aftertaste. Sweet and sticky. Drinkable, but also messy brew.

330ml bottle (Pothouse, Tallinn)
Smells of chilli peppers on top of a decent roast. Looks good, basically black, nice tight head. Very sweet taste, decent roast. Palate a bit flat and sweet and sticky, carbonation low. Finish sweet, a bit like cold milky coffee made with milk slightly on the turn - I can even imagine the spots of oil on the top surface. Too sweet, and that again just screams of milk thats heading in the offwards direction.

Black color with brown head that goes away completely, making the beer look like cola in the glass. The aroma makes me think of marshmallows. Roasted malts, smokey, vanilla sweetness and some sweet milk. Taste is grainy, roasty, a bit of smoke, bitter and ashy on the finish. You only get a slight sweetness right at the start, then it goes full-on roasty, bitter and coffee-forward. Body is heavy with a smooth feel and medium to low carbonation. Really nice breakfast beer indeed, rich, tasty and you dont get the 7.5% ABV.

Botella @ Sr. Lúpulo, Xixón. Espuma marrón escasa, efímera y con poca carbonatacion. Aroma a café, chocolate, lactosa y algo de vainilla. Sabor a café, vainilla y chocolate con leche. Bastante cuerpo, una gran cerveza.

Best by 7/9/2020 enjoyed 1/26/2016 in stemless wine glass.

Look - No head. Ring is barely there. Lacing is speckled. Body is closer to black as opposed to dark brown. 

Smell - Coffee. Chocolate. Coffee. Vanilla. Earthy. Coffee. Caramel.

Taste - Bitter. Coffee is not what I like in a coffee beer. Vanilla cream. 

Feel - Watery. Flat but not creamy. 

Overall - I need to cut back on beer and these Mikkeller releases may be it. Full blend was a gusher and Flat White was flat (I hope that is not what the name means). Bitter coffee and bitter chocolate.

Bottle from Beers of the World, Henrietta. Chocolate, coffee, and vanilla aroma. Taste is sweet; caramel, vanilla, chocolate, with a bug bitter roasty bite in the background that sticks around in the finish. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Very tasty.

12 oz. bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma brings out lovely notes of coffee upfront, followed by oats and maybe a subtle hint of the lactose but not much. Flavour is along the same lines, with a good balance of oats, coffee and vanilla. Full-bodied, with everything in great harmony. Excellent.
Bottle to tulip. Coffee, black licorice, cocoa bean and roast. Black with dark brown head. Taste of coffee and strong lactose sugar. Cold pressed coffee. Moderate high bitter. Dry finish.

Aroma is roasted malt, light coffee, a lot of lactose, chocolate, bready. Appearance is black, khaki head, poured thick. Taste is milky, sweet, roasted malt, light coffee and chocolate. Mouthfeel is watery, which is horribly disappointing. Medium body with very light carbonation, has the density of distilled water and a roasty aftertaste, slight milk. Overall, this is incredibly disappointing for how much they charge.

330 mL bottle. Black body. Khaki head. Coffee is the strongest aroma. Light lactose and some milk chocolate. Taste is really strong lactose. Chocolate. Coffee is definitely secondary. The finish has a fierce lactose resurgence. Really creamy body. Not sure if flat white refers to the carbonation, but its pretty low, adding to the creamy texture. Normally, I dont like lactose, but it doesnt seem to bother me in this. Tastes like a cafe con leche. Milky without the cloying milk sugar flavor.

Yep, this is what it says it is flat (but it isnt white). Very dark black. Subtle aroma of milk and coffee. Heavy, almost chewy. Very strong coffee. Somewhat buttery. Its good, but right after having a Ninkasi Noir, it just doesnt hold up at all. I want another Ninkasi Noir.

9th December 2015Craft Clerkenwell. Bottleshare. Thanks to Dan. Opaque dark brown beer, tidy tan head. Palate is airy, smooth and mildly dry. Modest fine carbonation. Smooth dark malts, mild creamy sweetness. Little coffee and cream. Touch of dark fruits. Light finish. Decent.

33cl bottle served in a snifter. Aroma is cocoa, coffee and ash. Taste is quite dry with the earthy coffee grounds with a nice dusty cocoa flavour and a moderate sweetness. Very well balanced and a good depth of flavour for the ABV which is very refreshing.

Bottle from Koht. I didnt take notes when had it, but no worries, it didnt deserve the effort. One of the biggest disappointments recently. Yea it was soft and smooth, both the oats and lactose apparent - and indeed flat - in the mouth, with rather strong coffee - even beany - and creamy notes both in aroma and taste, but boy was it dull and so unexciting compared to the rest of the Beer Geek series... Yet... Im not saying its not good.

Pitch black beer, very small tan head. Nose is roasty, stale coffee, chocolate, cocoa, ashy notes. Flavor is coffee, roast, milk chocolate, ash. Roasty-bitter finish with chocolate and dry notes. Palate is lighter than I expected.

Bottle at Craft Clerkenwell, thanks to Dirty Danny. It pours jet black with a moderate tan head. The nose is sweet, creamy, vanilla, rice pudding, light spice, sweet chocolate, coffee and earth. The taste is bitter  sweet, oily, slick, creamer, burnt caramel, hard roasted coffee, toasted dark fruits, light green veg and a touch of ash. Medium  full bodied with moderate carbonation. Another sweet adjunct stout. Fine for what it is.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2015  Dec 2015  - Bottle share at CBC Clerkenwell. Thanks to me. As Mikkeller Beer Geek Flat White, 7.5%. Well flat white coffees are amazing, so this has a lot to live up to. Black, small foamy brown head. Aroma is strong roast coffee, roast malt, spice, chilli, green pepper. Good stuff. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is coffee, smooth malt, light roast, some sweet demerara, ash in the finish. Really drinkable. Tasty. (3.8)
 Dec 2015  - Bottle to myself in Blaendulais.  The more this beer sits out in the air, the more it tastes like cheap cola.  I still enjoyed this, but perhaps it doesnt have the greatest drinkability.  (3.6)

Bottle. Pours very dark brown-black with borwn head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is coffee, roast, malt, lactose. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, coffee, malt, some dark chocolate. Finish is roast bitter with lingering sweetness. Overall: good.

Thick pour, with a very fine tan head with relatively good retention. Smells like milk oats, cocoa, brewed coffee and a bit of vanilla. The taste is underwhelming, but not bad - I am probably a bit biased, since I am having this beer right after the monster that is Black Hole. Sweet and roasty, heavy on the coffee and cocoa, I can actually say this is more like a coffee than a beer. Nice warm mouthfeel, thick and soft, a bit like a milk coffee. Not bad.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin creamy ta head. 
Clear black pour. Nice coffee notes. Lovely brew
Bottle shared. Pours near black with no head. Aroma of lactose, light roast, dark chocolate, toffee and light coffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared at the Craft Beer Co. Clerkenwell pre-Christmas tasting - London. Big thanks to Dan the Man for this beverage. Pours deep brown with a frothy beige head. Heavy coffee in the snout, some toasted hazelnuts, light roast, cocoa. Medium sweet flavor with burnt cereal, waxy chocolate, earth. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation and oily texture. Lightly warming in the finish, with more burnt cereal, milk chocolate, scorched earth. A bit simplistic, but tasty overall.

330ml bottle @ Ølhus København. Pours pitch black with a tiny head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee,cocoa and vanilla. Taste is silky smooth and slightly milky with loads of coffee, mild roastiness, hints of vanilla. Finish is smooth, milky and slightly roasty with some coffee notes. Quite slick and smooth. Good.

33cl bottle shared at Padraigs 2.5k Untap tasting in CBC CW, London. It pours a dark brown color with minimal beige head. Aroma is soft sweet roasted coffee with some caramel. Taste is sweet lightly boozy with caramel vanilla wood and roasted coffee beans. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok

Bottle split at the pre xmas tasting #Juan, thanks to Danny, 09/12/15.
Pitch black with a dirty tan head that dissipates to a swirl. 
Nose is sweet malt, toffee fudge, cocoa powder, coffee grinds, vanilla. 
Taste comprises coffee grinds, sweet malt, toffee fudge, light spice, faint tropicana, sweet licks. 
Medium + bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a decent boost.
Decent stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle in Ulfborg - shared with Mette. Pitch black - white head. Sweet. High malty. Bitterness. Coffee. Fresh coffee. Lactose. Cocoa. Chocolate. Licorice. Herbal. Not too sweet.

Bottle. Black body tan head. Aroma is coffee some caramel and hints of dried fruits. Taste is lactose and milk coffee with dark roasted malts. Aftertaste is nice roasted malts bitterness and milky sweetness.

330 ml bottle shared by Sebilinz, thanks!
Black body, with a medium, creamy, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of dry coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, some lactose, some chili.
Tastes of espresso, cocoa, dark chocolate, dark fruits, lactose.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, dry, roasty, with coffee, cocoa, some liquorice.

Tasty. Smooth and very well balanced, with the lactose just in the background. Typical, lovely coffee notes, like in the regular Beer Geek Breakfast. Great addition to the Beer Geek range.

0,33l bottle shared by Sebilinz at Linz RB Tasting, big thanks. BB 04/09/2020. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells roasted, coffee, chili, bitter herbs, light pepper, light earthy. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes roasted, (bitter) herbs, coffee, licorice, chocolate, very light chilis, earthy. finishes rather dry and some bitter herbs and chocolate. good stuff, dont get the lactice notes, rather obvious chili notes and some herbal, there is a light uncleanliness on this one. overall good beer, not the best beer geek I had.

roast notes: 3,5/5

Piana beżowa, drobna, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie przede wszystkim kawa - od mocnej kawy po turecku, poprzez espresso, na latte i cappuccino kończąc. W smaku dokładnie tak samo, najpierw goryczka kawowa, lekka kwaskowość także kawowa, na koniec delikatna słodycz kawy z mlekiem. Uczucie, jak byśmy rozgryzali ziarna kawy. W tle nuty palone, likier czekoladowy, ziemistość. W afterteasie tytoń i sos sojowy. Wysycenie niskie, pełne, aczkolwiek nie gęste w odbiorze. Alkohol tylko w formie nieznacznego rozgrzewania w przełyku. 
Świetny stout, solidna kawa, paloność, goryczka, jest troszkę kwaskowatości i słodyczy, która po ogrzaniu fajnie zlepia usta. Bardzo pijalne piwo przy swoim woltażu.
Bottle @ Bullerup Pubbens , Re-Opening/Solar eclipse pt. 2. Black body with a small offwhite head. Coffee, chocolate, smoky notes, light tartness, cream.
Bottle @ Bullerup Pubbens , Re-Opening/Solar eclipse pt. 2. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Brilliant coffee, roast, milky chocolate. Soft. Good

Bottle at The Bullerup Pubben reopening/Solar Eclipse pt. 2 tasting. It pours black with a creamy beige head. Loads of coffee in this. The cold version. Light smoked notes. Very light chocolate and a good roasty kick. Smoked and roasted flavour with great coffee notes mixed with creamy lacto notes. Light chocolate in the finish.
Bottle at Mikkeller. Completly black with no head at all, Smells heavy of malt and roasted coffee. Creamy and milky texture with notes of roasted coffee and dark choloate.
Bottle. Pours a deep opaque black with pretty much no head. Aroma and taste of espresso, burnt malts, slight chocolate.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ helsinki. Pours black with a thin brown head ash, cold coffee, roastedness in aroma. Flavor has coffee, oatmeal, chocolate, ash. Still quite balanced. Solid coffee beer.

Milky texture, dark color, sweet, coffee smell. The taste is bit coffee, milk of course and equal sweetness, not too much but a perfect blend. I wish there was more sweet to it, but a good beer. However, I paid $12 for on bottle!!! Expensive has hell, certainly not worth the price tag so I have to take that into account/
Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours dark brown with an attractive tan head and a coffee and treacle aroma. There is a rich dark molasses flavor with a lot of coffee. Smooth and tasty.

Bottled. Pours opaque blach with a small tan head. Arom of roasted malt, chocolate, coffe and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up dry with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Stout. 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

A black beer with a very small and dark brown head. Aroma has lots of black coffee, roastiness, some lactose and hint of fruitness. Taste is roasted, nice sweetness, mild bitterness. Medium+ bodied, smooth, low carbonation. Good amount of coffee, simple but very tastefull.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, coffee, chocolate, cocoa
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-good but too sweet
Bottle at viisi penniä, helsinki. Black color, tanned head. Aroma has roasty, smoke, coffee, some milk. Taste is espresso, roasty, milk. Very nice.

330 ml bottle in Ockelbo, thanks Alexis! Black with mocca head. Aroma of chocolate, milk chocolate, roasted malt, coffee and vanilla. Taste is sweet, milk chocolate up front, coffee, vanilla. Big bodied with a nice balance.

16/X/15 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 4/IX/20 (2015-1485) Thanks to Anthony for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep brown beer, small creamy beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of coffee, roasted, bit sourish, sweet, caramel. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: coffee, bitter touch, sweet, malty, caramel, lactose. Aftertaste: coffee, chocolate, cocoa powder, hoppy touch, caramel.
On tap. Pours black with moderate light tan head. Aromas of creamed black coffee and roasted malts. Flavors of dark nutty chocolate, rich oily coffee, vanilla, and dry toasted malts. Great balance.

Bottle @ home. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, some coffee and vanilla. Pours black with a tiny tan head, none lasting. Moderate sweetness, light+ malt bitterness and malt dryness. Full body, thick smooth texture, light carb., sweet roasted malt finish.
Way better than Vanilla Shake. Lactose did it perfectly. Nice coffee aroma, great milky twist and a small carbonation. Perfect one.
One of the best from Beer Geek series. Rich, coffee like with perfect twist of sweetness from lactose. Like a very good coffee with milk.

Cest très crémeux au goût et jaime bien ça. Cest pas hyper gourmand mais cest assez net et long en bouche de faon très élégante. Souvent avec les stout ce qui mimporte cest la qualité de la longueur en bouche et du petit cinéma que provoque cette traînée aromatique. Et là, ce film est particulièrement évocateur.

33 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a creamy and brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Sweet, toasted, caramelish. Toasted and bitter. Seems smooth milky. Slight caramelish and toasted to chocolate finish.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar Barcelona. Black colour with tan head. Roasted and coffee aroma. Roasted, coffee, milk, chocolate, sweet. Medium to full body.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at Isobels, Eardisley, Herefordshire, Friday 30th October 2015.  Huge coffee, lots and lots of coffee. Black as yer at with a tan rim.The lactose is showing, this is smooth, quite thick in the mouth but its a one-way street of coffee. Milky, creamy and a little sweet but its all about the coffee. A7 A4 T8 P5 Ov16 4.0
pour black, without a head. coffee aromas, medium roasted, taste medium bitter, soft, light, not sweet at all. average carbonation, creamy without being heavy.

From bottle. Pours pitch black with no head. Aroma of roasted barley, coffee, candy sugar. Taste: surely a milk stout! Lots of lactose, vanilla, thin body for a milk stout, super boring and dissapointing. Not worthy of the Beer Geek name.

Bottle ty Rekvium. Pours pitch black no head. Aroma roasted barley, brown sugar, coffe, lactic, licorice. Taste is quite sweet, roasted barley, lactic, vanilla. Texture is creamy with a very soft cabonation.
Bottled:Pours black with a small head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, toffee and burnt milk. Taste is dark, bitter chocolate and coffee. Pretty good, but the finish is a little bit too harsh.

duft kaffemørk ristet malt svag duft af tobak
smag: kaffe sød lidt brændt smag. lidt karamel sirup eftersmag. man fornemmer laktosen når den bliver varmer.
330 ml. bottle. Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, lactose, chocolate, and some dark fruit. Nice.
Bottle at tderoeck's place. Coffee, light sweet, chocolate, milky, nice beer! Like all beer geeks.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen - black pour with tan head. Dark roasted and medium sweet malty aroma and taste with prominent coffee, milky chocolate, caramel, vanilla, some dark fruits, roasted finish.

12-OCT-2015, bottle @Mortens, from Mikkeller & Friends.
Black with low tan head. Roast, coffee - loads of coffee. Milky, Creamy, very soft, almost flat.
330-ml bottle from mikkeller beer club. plenty of head, sweet porter nose, hoppy, milky, ashy, bitter finish.

Pechschwarz mit deutlicher Kaffeenote in der Nase. Geschmack nach cremigem süssem Espresso, im Abgang leichte Röstsäure. Direkt von Mikkeller. Top Stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with a small and quick fading beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, lactose, liquorice root and some chocolate. Flavour is sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, a bit thin texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet, turn roasted and coffee clearly dominating.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with tan nice lasting creamy head. Aroma is very sweet, fresh brewed coffee, lactose, burnt fruits, dark fruits, kaffegrums, deep, milky, roast and oaty sweetness. Taste is more up front roast barley, figs, low carbonation and coffee-like, milky sweetness, velvety and yet sugary, roasty coffee and slight fruity coffee. Long roasty finish. Very balanced and smooth. Sweet and turns roasty. An elegant one.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty coffee aroma with hints of chocolate. Roasted malty chocolate and coffee flavor with milky hints. Has a roasted malty milky coffee finish.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Pitch black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and coffee with notes of dried fruits.
Sweet and roasted flavor of caramel, coffee, chocolate and dried fruits with notes of lactose.
Roasted finish.
